p.s: Shakespeare's Conquest of Germany
I am sure that everyone has heard of William Shakespeare at least once in their lifetime.
And when I say everyone, I mean people with different languages in different countries.
Shakespeare has a global impact which is why today, I am focusing on my home country Germany.
It would make sense to not only look at the origin of Shakespeare's work in Germany, but also determine the relationship between the city of origin called Weimar and the poet.
Christoph Martin Wieland translated, as the first germanGerman ever, Shakespearean drama in germanGerman language.
22 of those dramas were published in Zürich between 1762 and 1766.
furthermore, there hashave been found traces of Shakespeare's innovation in literature, written by well-known germanGerman poets, like Lessing, Goethe and Herder.
In addition Goethe, Herder and Wieland were forming the germanGerman Shakespeare Renaissance, which found its way towards the German city Weimar.
At this place the oldest literary organization of germanyGermany was formed in 1864 called the Shakespeare Organization
William Shakespeare was welcomed with open arms in the city of Weimar.
His works were presented at the Weimarer Hof Theater, which led to the unification of the Verein der Shakespeare Freunde, an association on 8th April 1864.
Tendant Franz von Dingelstedt directed a cycle of historic dramas during that time, which had such a big impact on society, to form the Shakespeare Organization.
Later on, at the 40th anniversary of the organization and the 340th birthday of William Shakespeare, the first ever Shakespeare memorial in Europe was built by Otto Lessing and the Ilmpark in Weimar.
This action show the great honor Shakespeare is given by the Weimar people and how his person and his work will live on in their memories.
It now becomes clear that this poet had a big impact on our literature by inspiring German poets as well as the people of Weimar and opening wider aspects of German literature.
Enough said.
